description.narrative: Mozambique is rapidly evolving into a middle income country due to a stable GDP growth of >7.0%, making it one of the fastest growing countries in Africa. Despite this growth, it remains one of the poorest and most unequal countries in the world. Chronic malnutrition continues to rise and agricultural production is decreasing. Mozambique ranks third amongst the African countries most exposedto risks from multiple weather-related hazards, such as; floods, cyclones, droughts, and related epidemics where as much as 25% of the population is at risk from droughts, floods, and cyclones. Hence our 3 programs are the focus: Governance with the AGIR2 program as the large main platform; Sustainable Livelihoods with activities mainly in the North which are now being evaluated and reorganized to generate a more sustainable impact at a lower cost; and the Humanitarian activities (capacity building and direct disasteraid) scattered throughout the coastal regions and along the river basins based on the Oxfam Humanitarian dossier imperative. In Mozambique there are interrelated factors such as climate change, the impact of the extractive industries, and gender inequality which combine to hamper the promotion of the citizens´ right to be heard. These themes will, therefore, be taken into consideration duringthe design and implementation of all programs and projects. Although a fast growing and relatively stable country, Mozambique is still a donor darling. Because of this and because of the clear underdevelopment of most of the country we deem that generous amounts of funds will be made available in the coming years (this in contrast with many other (near) middle income countries). To raise funds for our project and programmes we will: - Build donor confidence based on quality delivery of existing projects. - Build donor relationship by senior staff and the funding manager. - Coalition forming (with other INGO#s) as a preferred approach. - Step up media effort to show our actions and results to donors and influencers. - Respond on calls for proposals that fit well into our OCS and within our delivery capacity - Proactive proposal development, creating a pipeline. - Develop (new) expertise like: water governance, seeds, coalition building, gender EI, climate change, innovative humanitarian aid/resilience etc. and evidence building - Close interaction with regional and affiliate donor managers that have up to date donor mapping and can provide entrance to donors and specific content assistance.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib is one of the 17 national affiliates of the Oxfam International Confederation. It started life in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Working together in confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education forall, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam established this country office to support local organizations and projects. Through this local office Oxfam Novib directly contributes towards this project’s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation

description.narrative: Women and Men able to: # of people (M/F) living in poverty and injustice use their enhanced knowledge and skills to fullfill their rights on freedom of association, freedom of expression and to participate in public affairs.
